skillTree.localised_description: An unholy battle altar dedicated to the Great Horned Rat, the boiling fumes drive the protecting forces of the Pestilent Brotherhood into a frenzy and bring plague to their foes.

effects.description: Mount: Cauldron of a Thousand Poxes

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
If you've got the Warptokens and the contacts, you can get all manner of fine, murderous armaments crafted to fit claw or tail perfectly.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Rikzik's greatest asset is how well he can beg the rest of the Pestilent Brotherhood for supplies. It's pathetic and demeaning, but he works with what he's got.

effects.description:
Beseech cost: -10% for all unit recruitment rites
	(factionwide)

Beseech cost: -20% for all unit recruitment rites
	(factionwide)

Beseech cost: -30% for all unit recruitment rites
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Despite Clan Feesik's status as the weakest of all the Pestilent Brotherhood, it is still considered a full member of the Brotherhood, and Rikzik trades on that status as heavily as he can, especially when enforcing discipline amongst his own ranks.
The rats of Clan Feesik know one thing well - how to run away. At that, they are truly excellent.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases as the unit takes damage

skillTree.localised_description: Like any good Skaven, the pusbags of Clan Feesik want the enemy to hit the other rat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby allied entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: Never one to stray too close to the front lines of combat, Rikzik can still deliver truly devastating amounts of plague and corruption to the enemy forces.
One of the few artefacts remaining to Clan Feesik, this great pox cauldron befouls the weapons of all Skaven. Naturally, Rikzik trusts no one other than himself to carry it into battle.
Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
As you might expect, the forces of order are repelled by the Skaven and their myriad disgusting, disease-ridden ways.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves, Lizardmen, Dwarfs and men

skillTree.localised_description: Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Clan Feesik has little with which it can work, so the warlords of the clan learn to do the best with what they have available.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Skavenslaves units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Skavenslaves units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Skavenslaves units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and thread

skillTree.localised_description: This one's intimate knowledge of the inner workings of Skaven machinery enables him to improve their efficiency on the battlefield.

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere  even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle  spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

factionEffects.localised_description: Weak and penniless, Rikzik trusts no one, not even his own underlings. Clan Feesik is full of fearful, back-stabbing, cretins, and Rikzik is merely the best of them. He's going to get his, and everyone else better get out of his way.

effects.description: Beseech the Brotherhood: Pathetic and weak, Clan Feesik is nothing but a thrall of Clan Pestilens, and must beseech the Pestilent Brotherhood for anything more than the most basic of units.
Diplomatic relations: +30 with the factions of the Pestilent Brotherhood
Upkeep cost: -4% for all armies for each active war while a thrall of Clan Pestilens

Gain following for 3 turns after Clan Pestilens declares war:
	  Beseech cost: -20% for Plague Monks, Plague Monk Censer Bearers, and Plagueclaw Catapults rites
	  Campaign Movement Range: +25% (all armies)
	  Underway Evasion Chance: +25% (all armies)
Plagues bolster your armies and nurture your settlements
Rite cooldown: -15 turns for "The Pestilent Scheme"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Weak and penniless, Rikzik trusts no one, not even his own underlings. Clan Feesik is full of fearful, back-stabbing, cretins, and Rikzik is merely the best of them. He's going to get his, and everyone else better get out of his way.

effects.description: Steal +25% of the experience earned by other Lords
Magic item drop chance from battle: +25%
